title: How to Clean and Winterize Repossessed Homes

steps.headline: Secure the foreclosed home.
Clean the outside of the home.
Clean the inside of the home.
Have a pest control expert or exterminator inspect the property in case there are termites, mice or other infestations.
Talk to the lender about how often the interior of the home should be cleaned.
steps.description: Some banks might want only one good cleaning done, and others might want the place cleaned on a regular basis.

steps.headline: Shut off all utilities.
steps.description: This includes electricity, gas and water. Unplug all appliances and turn off electrical breakers.

steps.headline: Drain the pipes.
Wrap the pipes after you drain them.
steps.description: Any kind of insulation will work to keep the pipes warm enough to avoid cracking or bursting.

steps.headline: Pour antifreeze into toilets, drains and in the bottom of washing machines, dishwashers and any other appliance that uses water.
steps.description: Look for antifreeze made for recreational vehicles (RVs). It should be pink in color.

steps.headline: Prepare for snow and ice.
steps.description: Shovel or plow any driveways or walkways, and make sure heavy snow does not accumulate on the roof or it could cause leaking or caving.

steps.headline: Post signs noting that the home has been winterized.
steps.description: This will dissuade visitors or realtors from trying to use the sinks or toilets.

text:
Cleaning Repossessed Homes Secure the foreclosed home. Change locks to all doors. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make sure the windows and other entries are locked from the inside. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Clean the outside of the home. This will keep the property from becoming an eyesore or a dumping ground in the neighborhood. Mow the lawn. Remember to check back every week or two to keep it mowed. Trim hedges, bushes, trees and weeds. You do not have to do extensive yard and landscaping work when cleaning the home, but make sure it looks neat. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Tow any junk cars that are in the driveway or on the property and haul away any trash or debris that has gathered outside the house. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Drain any swimming pools and secure any outbuildings including sheds, barns or storage buildings. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Clean the inside of the home. The lender will want real estate agents to be able to show the property, so it must be in presentable condition. Haul away any trash and broken or damaged appliances, furniture and other items left in the home. You might want to try selling or auctioning anything that was left behind and is still of value. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Vacuum, sweep and mop the floors. Remove any stained or damaged carpets and fix or replace broken tiles, light fixtures and hardware. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Wipe down walls, surfaces and other fixtures with an antibacterial spray or cloth. Note any major damage so the lender can decide whether to make any repairs. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Have a pest control expert or exterminator inspect the property in case there are termites, mice or other infestations. Talk to the lender about how often the interior of the home should be cleaned. Some banks might want only one good cleaning done, and others might want the place cleaned on a regular basis. Winterizing Repossessed Homes Shut off all utilities. This includes electricity, gas and water. Unplug all appliances and turn off electrical breakers. Drain the pipes. Once the water is shut off, there will still be water left in the pipes. If that water is left in there, it can freeze and damage the home's plumbing. Turn on every faucet and water fixture once the main water is turned off to drain. Flush toilets until they will not flush again. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":315,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":520.934065934066,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Hook up an air compressor to a ice maker supply line to blow out any remaining water in the pipes. Remember to turn faucets back off after you drain the water. Otherwise, the house could flood once the water is turned back on. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Clean-and-Winterize-Repossessed-Homes-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":315,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":520.934065934066,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Wrap the pipes after you drain them. Any kind of insulation will work to keep the pipes warm enough to avoid cracking or bursting. Pour antifreeze into toilets, drains and in the bottom of washing machines, dishwashers and any other appliance that uses water. Look for antifreeze made for recreational vehicles (RVs). It should be pink in color. Prepare for snow and ice. Shovel or plow any driveways or walkways, and make sure heavy snow does not accumulate on the roof or it could cause leaking or caving. Post signs noting that the home has been winterized. This will dissuade visitors or realtors from trying to use the sinks or toilets.
